com.opengamma.strata.market.value

Interface PriceIndexValues

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ForwardPriceIndexValues

    public interface PriceIndexValues
    Provides access to the values of a price index.

    This provides historic and forward values for a single PriceIndex, such as 'US-CPI-U'. This is typically used in inflation products.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CurveCurrencyParameterSensitivities curveParameterSensitivity(InflationRateSensitivity pointSensitivity)
      Calculates the curve parameter sensitivity from the point sensitivity.
      CurveName getCurveName()

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        PriceIndex getIndex()
        Gets the Price index.

        The index that the rates are for.

        Returns:
        the Price index

      • getValuationMonth

        YearMonth getValuationMonth()
        Gets the valuation month.

        The raw data in this provider is calibrated for this month.

        Returns:
        the valuation month

      • getTimeSeries

        LocalDateDoubleTimeSeries getTimeSeries()
        Gets the time-series of fixings for the index.

        The time-series contains historic fixings of the index. It may be empty if the data is not available.

        Returns:
        the time-series fixings

      • getCurveName

        CurveName getCurveName()
        Gets the name of the underlying curve.
        Returns:
        the underlying curve name

      • getParameterCount

        int getParameterCount()
        Gets the number of parameters defining the curve.

        If the curve has no parameters, zero must be returned.

        Returns:
        the number of parameters

      • value

        double value(YearMonth fixingMonth)
        Gets the historic or forward rate at the specified fixing month.

        The rate of the Price index, such as 'US-CPI-U', varies over time. This method obtains the actual or estimated rate for the month.

        This retrieves the actual rate if the fixing month is before the valuation month, or the estimated rate if the fixing month is after the valuation month. If the month equals the valuation month, then the best available value is returned.

        Parameters:
        fixingMonth - the fixing month to query the rate for
        Returns:
        the value of the index, either historic or forward
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the value cannot be obtained

      • valuePointSensitivity

        PointSensitivityBuilder valuePointSensitivity(YearMonth month)
        Calculates the point sensitivity of the historic or forward value at the specified fixing month.

        This returns a sensitivity instance referring to the curve used to determine the forward value. If a time-series was used, then there is no sensitivity. The sensitivity refers to the result of value(YearMonth).

        Parameters:
        month - the month to find the sensitivity for
        Returns:
        the point sensitivity of the value
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the result cannot be calculated

      • unitParameterSensitivity

        CurveUnitParameterSensitivities unitParameterSensitivity(YearMonth month)
        Calculates the unit parameter sensitivity of the forward value at the specified fixing month.

        This returns the unit sensitivity to each parameter on the underlying curve at the specified date. The sensitivity refers to the result of value(YearMonth).

        Parameters:
        month - the month to find the sensitivity for
        Returns:
        the parameter sensitivity
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the value cannot be obtained

      • curveParameterSensitivity

        CurveCurrencyParameterSensitivities curveParameterSensitivity(InflationRateSensitivity pointSensitivity)
        Calculates the curve parameter sensitivity from the point sensitivity.

        This is used to convert a single point sensitivity to curve parameter sensitivity. The calculation typically involves multiplying the point and unit sensitivities.

        Parameters:
        pointSensitivity - the point sensitivity to convert
        Returns:
        the parameter sensitivity
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the result cannot be calculated
